head.title: Sept. 10-16; European Tempers Flare Over Taxes on Costly Gas

hedline.hl1: Sept. 10-16; European Tempers Flare Over Taxes on Costly Gas

block.p: With the price of crude oil surging to a 10-year high of $35 a barrel, truckers and farmers across Europe erupted in fury at the soaring cost of their highly taxed gas and diesel fuel, barricading refineries and depots and bringing urban centers to a halt with slow-moving convoys. Britain saw 90 percent of its 12,500 filling station go dry before the siege ended. France, Italy and Belgium gave in to protesters' demands for tax breaks while Britain, Ireland, Spain, Germany and the Netherlands held the line.
